Educational/Professional Background

Degrees Earned:

Master of Divinity from Princeton Theological Seminary (Spring 2020)

Bachelor of Arts in History and Religious Studies from the University of North Carolina at Charlotte (Spring 2017)

Work Experience:

Pastor of Youth Ministry at Pennington Presbyterian Church in NJ

Teaching Assistant at Princeton Seminary and UNC Charlotte

Visiting Scholar at the University of Glasgow

Writing Instructor with UNC Charlotte and the Princeton Writing Academy

Research and Teaching Interests, or Professional Field

I am interested in the religious and philosophical foundations of hope, and especially how hope is reimagined or recalibrated in the face of disillusionment, disenchantment, and disappointment. I primarily focus on how revolutionaries in post-revolutionary moments overcome disillusionment, and in my writing and teaching I hope to help students, activists, scholars, and the general public to cultivate resilient postures toward the world around them.
